title.narrative: NATIONAL CAPACITY FOR EVIDENCE GENERATION

description.narrative: By 2025, relevant national and local authorities have increased capacity to generate relevant and solid evidence to inform policy- making as well as to monitor and ensure implementation of policies for children, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Evaluation, Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, public and private entities and civil society demonstrate a shared commitment and increased investments in child rights.

related-activity.ref: 4350/A0/06/884 EXPANDED ACCOUNTABILITY AND INVESTMENT FOR CR

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2025, relevant national and local authorities have increased capacity to generate relevant and solid evidence to inform policy-making as well as to monitor and ensure implementation of policies for children

description.narrative: UNICEF continued collaboration and partnership with relevant government institutions especially Turkstat, Presidency of Strategy and Budget, MoFSS, academic institutions and UN agencies to address data gaps on children, especially on Sustainable Development Goals. Through Child Research Project which is led by Ministry of Family and Social Services will enable comprehensive data mapping and identifying data gaps to measure multi-dimensional child wellbeing using household survey and administrative data. Continued partnership with Koc University is aimed to strengthen evidence generation including knowledge management and capacity in evaluation and monitoring. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:21/01/2022

title.narrative: Status of 2021 IMERP implementation, Text

target.value: 2021:At least 80% of IMERP activities planned for completion in 2021 are finalized

actual.value: 2021:75% of IMERP activities planned in 2021 are completed

target.value: 2021:At least 80% of IMERP activities planned for completion in 2021 are finalized

actual.value: 2021:75% of IMERP activities planned in 2021 are completed

title.narrative: Status of TCO Knowledge Management Strategy, Text

target.value: 2021:KM strategy developed by July and at least 80% of its components planned for completion in 2021 are implemented by year end

actual.value: 2021:Consultations on focus of the KM Strategy and Action plan were conducted in Q4 2021. It will be finalised in February 2022

target.value: 2021:KM strategy developed by July and at least 80% of its components planned for completion in 2021 are implemented by year end

title.narrative: Content of Official Statistical Programme (OSP) 2022-2026, Text

baseline.value: OSP 2017-2021 includes activities that are insufficient to cover the data gaps on children

target.value: 2025:OSP 2022-2026 includes activities to cover data gaps in at least 5 identified domains of child statistics

actual.value: 2021: OSP 2022-2026 includes data and survey interventions that address major data gaps identified. More work for each sector will take place in 2022

title.narrative: Content of Official Statistical Programme (OSP) 2022-2026, Text

baseline.value: OSP 2017-2021 includes activities that are insufficient to cover the data gaps on children

target.value: 2025:OSP 2022-2026 includes activities to cover data gaps in at least 5 identified domains of child statistics

actual.value: 2021: OSP 2022-2026 includes data and survey interventions that address major data gaps identified. More work for each sector will take place in 2022

title.narrative: Status of methodology to measure multi-dimensional child wellbeing based on admin data, Text

target.value: 2025:methodology designed and adopted by Turkstat for the production of regular statistics

actual.value: 2021:Delayed: Comprehensive child data mapping and gap analysis is being conducted in collaboration with PSB and MoFSS. Results will inform the methodology draft that will be completed in 2022
